references.paper_title: Performance characterisation of the 64-core sg2042 risc-v cpu for hpc
references.reason: This paper is important because it characterizes the performance of the SG2042, the main platform studied in the submitted paper.
This paper is important because it generally discusses LLM inference on CPUs, which is directly relevant to the submitted work.

references.paper_title: Characterizing and optimizing transformer inference on arm many-core processor
references.reason: This paper is important because it studies the optimization of transformer inference, similarly to the work of the submitted paper but for ARM architectures.

references.paper_title: Qigen: Generating efficient kernels for quantized inference on large language models
references.reason: This paper is important because it explores kernel optimizations for quantized inference in LLMs, aligning with the optimization strategies in the submitted paper.
This paper is important because it refers to the foundational LLM inference framework that is used as the baseline in the research described in the submitted paper.
